result.execSummary:
The defendant Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*08-18-2022/Rest. Hearing - Court ordered restitution in the amount of $675.00 payable to victim CB. Failure to pay by December 1, 2023 will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.*
Restitution to be addressed at future Court Date.

Provide a DNA sample by August 12th, 2022, if not already provided; pay the DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges payable in 18 months. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waived all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a restitution hearing. Statements made by victim CB. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $675.00 payable to victim CB. Failure to pay by December 1, 2023 will result in civil judgment/tax intercept.

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered Defendant to serve FIVE MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges PAYABLE IN 18 MONTHS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by AUGUST 12TH, 2022, if not already provided, and pay the DNA surcharge.

Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

RESTITUTION TO BE ADDRESSED AT FUTURE COURT DATE.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN.

Defendant Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

AS TO COUNT 2 - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing to proceed.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, received and filed
Elements of the Offense/ WIS JI - Criminal

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests in person plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waives defendant's appearance. Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery but is awaiting an offer and requests an adjournment. 
Court orders matter adjourned. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roquell Monshy-Daruis Foster appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
